page.title: 11SOME WALKS AROUND CHALFORD
page.content: The Canal:- The canal,which runs through the Golden Valley is the highlight of Chalford.It is a good scenic route and a very enjoyable walk.It is half grown over with reeds but still contains water.The canal is owned by the Severn Trent Water Authority.It runs paralell with the River Frome,through beautiful deciduous woodland. Oakridge:- Oakridge is a small village to the north east of Chalford. There is a tiny school,which is one hundred and eleven years old,and the Church of St. Bartholomew.There is a Pub called The Butcher's Arms.Oakridge is a village with many beautiful old Cotswold stone houses.There are also some pretty wooded walks near the village.
